column2: ALABAMA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: drive above the posted speed limit.
column6: tailgate the driver in front of you.

column2: 2. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 3. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
4. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear
column6: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way

column2: 5. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 6. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 7. Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
8. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
9. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 21. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 22. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 23. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 24. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column2: 25. When turning, drivers should:
column4: always move to the right lane.
column8: increase their speed to improve stability.

column2: 26. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 27. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 28. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column6: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.
column8: all students are off the bus.

column2: 29. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 30. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
31. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
32. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 33. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 34. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column6: help create a safe driving environment.
column8: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 35. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 36. On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
37. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 38. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column6: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column8: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.

column2: 39. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop and yield the right of way.
column8: Stop and wait for the green light

column2: 40. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:

Question Text
1. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column8: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 2. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
3. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 4. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 5. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 6. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 7. Drivers should always be looking:
column6: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.
column8: directly in front of the car.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 9. Which sign has white letters on a red background?

column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 11. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 12. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column6: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.

column2: 13. Stopping distances:

column2: 14. A curb painted red means:

column2: 15. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?

column2: 16. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:

column2: 17. When driving at night, drivers should:
